page.title: 03ROUNDBUSH FARM LAYER MARNEY
page.content: Mr and Mrs A J Round are arable farmers. They own 700 acres of land. They have a turbo charged tractor. The seat cost Â£2500! 2 full time men, 1 partime man and a student work for him. Mrs Round has 10 horses which she trains for shows. The house was first built in 1400. The timber frames inside were growing when the first Domesday book was being written. The house has no foundations. It rests on wooden rafts. In the Second World War a bomb dropped nearby and damaged it. The Rounds have got 2 Labradors, 1 Dachshund, and a Lurcher. They used to have 400 sheep, but they gave them up 20 years ago. Mr and Mrs Round have lived here 34 years, but Mr Round's family have farmed in the area since 1726. He loves farming and his home. Mechanisation is the greatest change he has seen.
